p: The malformation rate observed in children born to HIV-positive mothers is broadly similar to that observed in the general population [ 40]. Molecule-by-molecule analyses have identified some risk but with contradictory results depending on the study, such as those that followed the alert on efavirenz-related neural tube-closure abnormalities [ 39]. A low risk of cardiac malformation – most often of minimal severity – has been observed after exposure to zidovudine [ 40]. More recently, an alert has suggested possible neural-tube toxicity of dolutegravir, pending further analysis [ 23]. This information would urge caution in the large-scale use of this new molecule which has, however, much potential interest in terms of efficiency, genetic barriers to resistance, and cost.
